text:
March 9, 1954
TO s All NAEB Directors
Fromt Harry J. Skoraia
"Dear Harrys j
The Paulus, H°veys and Greshkoffs are having a great time in the
Eternal City - and we all love NAEB and Senator Fulbright at this point*
This letter is a hasty business comment, though, not a gossip sheet.®
Today my father relayed from London a proposal from Dick Hull that
I attend a UNESCO TV meeting in London in July, and suggesting I
5follow through with Harry Skornia, suggesting your availability.®
My father only paraphrased most of Dick9s letter, so that all details
are not clear. However, I am sending off this note to indicate my
interest and availability. So....if the matter comes to NAEB attention,
keep me in mind. And...if additional representation is required from
NAEB ranks, you might keep Creshkoff and Hovey In mind too.
Regards,
Burton*
